page.title: 17THORNHILL HEALTH
page.content: On the whole,the general health of the people is good.Most of the adult diseases are,sadly,related to smoking and drinking.Children have the usual diseases such as measles,mumps and chickenpox although now there is immunisation against a few of these.Not so long ago people died of scarlet fever,diphtheria and tuberculosis but today these have been almost eradicated.The nearest hospital is in Stirling.There is no doctor in Thornhill and most people are patients of Dr.Burnett or Dr.McColl in Doune or Dr.Scott in Kippen.Nurse Moore is the district nurse who lives in Thornhill.A visit to the dentist necessitates a journey to Callander or Stirling.
